main event: On 6 February 1959, an unidentified flying object was observed over Boulder, Colorado, described as a brilliant white light hovering at an altitude of 3000 to 5000 feet.
interesting points: The object was approximately 10 to 15 feet in diameter and exhibited changes in size, increasing and then diminishing repeatedly., The sighting lasted for about 5 minutes., Deputy Sheriff H. L. Garner and the Boulder County Undersheriff were among the confirmed witnesses., An unidentified private pilot also reported the sighting., The Air Force investigation suggested it might be a natural meteorological phenomenon, potentially a lenticular cloud formation.
sighted object: a brilliant white light in the sky
witness description: Deputy Sheriff, Undersheriff, and an unidentified private pilot
